CatDescriptText: Gloria Allen, recent college graduate, Beltzhoover and Gloria Yanko, high school graduate, Library, were part of Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 13, 1960, pg. 1 with question: "What are the most appealing and least appealing aspects of the Democratic Presidential candidate, Senator John F. Kennedy?"  Ms. Allen's answer reads: "I think that his youth, although many think that it is detrimental, is one of his biggest assets."  Ms. Yanko's answer reads: "I go all out for Kennedy.  I heard one speech that he delivered, and I liked it greatly.  It was plain like the people that you know and meet every day.  he reminds me of Roosevelt, and I think that he will be a great President like Roosevelt."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Gloria Allen wearing eyeglasses and light colored short sleeved blouse, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Gloria Yanko wearing light colored short sleeved top, with purse with bamboo handles over arm, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
